oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newman L. Cheek, circa 1954
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Mr. Newman L. Cheek, a prominent Middle Tennessee businessman, circa 1954. Cheek was the youngest son of Joel Cheek, Sr., founder of the Maxwell House of Coffee Company. He married Sarah Richardson Johnson and the couple moved to Madison, Tennessee in 1928 and built their home of the banks of the Cumberland River. Mr. Cheek founded the Lakewood Water Company to serve the surrounding community and by 1939, when the company’s name was changed to Madison Suburban Utility District, the plant had extended its service to Madison and Goodlettsville. Cheek was well-known for his numerous contributions to Middle Tennessee and he established Jackson Park which stands at the entrance of the Jackson Park Subdivision and personally provided the property for the Inglewood Library. He served as a member of the Board of Trustees of George Peabody College for thirty years and was named a life member. Mr. Cheek was involved in the growth and development of all of Davidson County and was a member of the Board of Directors of Nashville Bank and Trust Company and continued in that capacity after the merger with Third National Bank. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cheek family; Cheek, Newman L., 1896-1979
